intro: Hieracium subspeciosum subsp. amauradenium, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind.
